properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Bayindeen, Buangor, Warrak. 

  • There is a bushfire at the Langi Ghiran State Park that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

Incident Location: Langi Ghiran State Park
Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 03:05 am
Next Update: Friday 27 December 2024, 12:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35435/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Bayindeen, Buangor, Warrak. 

- There is a bushfire at the Langi Ghiran State Park that is not yet under control.
- Firefighters are currently responding to this fire. 
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Halls Gap
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Halls Gap. 
  • This Emergency Warning replaces the emergency warning issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control. 
  •  The bushfire is travelling from the Grampians National Park in an easterly direction towards Halls Gap.  
  • The fire has crossed Sundial Rd. It is too late to leave the area safely so you must take shelter now. 
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune to ABC or Local radio to stay informed.
If you left Halls Gap. Bellfield, Bellfield Junction, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
Relief centres are open at
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Register your attendance at Ararat Relief centre via this link
  • Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding.  
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc") 22 Patrick Street, Stawell. 
  • Register your attendance at Stawell Relief Centre via this link
  • Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times. 

  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:
  • Embers are starting small fires ahead of the main fire.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • The Mt William communications tower is likely to be impacted affecting both mobile phone and NBN services. Tune into local radio for emergency updates.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 04:10 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return
Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road
Issue Date: Friday 27 December 2024, 07:06 am
Next Update: Friday 27 December 2024, 04:10 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35442/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Halls Gap. 
- This Emergency Warning replaces the emergency warning issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas. 
- There is a bushfire at Grampians National      Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control. 
-  The bushfire is travelling from the      Grampians National Park in an easterly direction towards Halls      Gap.  
- The fire has crossed Sundial Rd.  It is too late to leave the area safely so you      must take shelter now. 
- Winds are expected to sustain over the coming      days from the West - South West. 
- The communications tower at Mt William has      been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune to      ABC or Local radio to stay informed.  


If you left Halls Gap. Bellfield, Bellfield Junction, it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. 

What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
- Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
- Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
- Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
Relief centres are open at
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
- Register your attendance at Ararat Relief centre via this link
- Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding.  
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc") 22 Patrick Street, Stawell. 
- Register your attendance at Stawell Relief Centre via this link
- Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times. 

- Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
- Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cheshunt, Myrrhee, Whitlands, Whitfield.

  • There is a bushfire 9 km south west of Whitfield that is not yet under control.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Smoke will may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Wartook, Zumsteins, Glenisla, Ledcourt, Roses Gap
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Fyans Creek, Glenisla, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Roses Gap, Wartook, Zumsteins.

  • This Advice replaces Advice issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.  
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions. Please avoid travelling today.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 06:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Cathcart, Denicull Creek, Maroona, Norval, Rocky Point, Rossbridge, Langi Logan, Tatyoon
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Cathcart, Denicull Creek, Langi Logan, Maroona, Norval, Rocky Point, Rossbridge, Tatyoon.

  • This Watch and Act replaces Watch and Act issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.  
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.  
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Relief Centres
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre, 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Register your attendance at Ararat Relief centre via this link
  • Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding.  
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc") 22 Patrick Street, Stawell. 
  • Register your attendance at Stawell Relief Centre via this link
  • Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times. Hamilton - Monivae College, 133 Ballarat Road, Hamilton
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 04:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Advice message is being issued for Grantville, Jam Jerrup, Lang Lang, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh.

  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
  • Fire fighters continue to work on extinguishing hot spots.
  • Smoke may be visible.
  • This Advice message replaces the Community Information message issued at 2:44pm on 24 December 2024.
  • Although there is no immediate threat you should continue to monitor the situation and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters continue to patrol this fire.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Boolarra, Boolarra South. 

  • There is a bushfire at Barktown Rd, Boolarra South that is contained.
  • Firefighters will continue to monitor this fire throughout the day tomorrow.
  • There is currently no threat to communities, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Although there is no immediate threat to the community you should review and update your fire plan now as the situation may change over the next 24 hours or so.
  • The forecast for 26 December 2024, is for hot conditions with strong and gusty north to north westerly winds.
  • Due to the increased fire risk tomorrow a total fire ban has been issued for all of Victoria from midnight tonight (25 December) to midnight tomorrow (26 December).

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by Wednesday, December 25 at 5.00PM or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Invermay, Nerrina.

  • There is a grassfire at Kiewa St, Nerrina that is under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the message issued at 9.15 on 26 December 2024.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. Find information on protecting yourself and your family: https://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/am-i-at-risk/grassfires-near-cities-and-towns. 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Emergency vehicles may still seen in or around the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • The Mt William communications tower may be impacted therefore mobile phone and NBN services may be disrupted. Tune into ABC radio to stay informed.
If you left the area it is Not Safe to Return. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.

  • Register your attendance at Stawell relief centre via this link.Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times.

  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

- Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
- Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
- Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Relief Centres:
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
- Register your attendance at Ararat relief centre via this link.
- Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times.  Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding. 
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc"), 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
- Register your attendance at Stawell relief centre via this link.Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times. 
- Hamilton - Monivae College133 Ballarat Road, Hamilton.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap road

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Lake Bolac, Mininera, Stavely, Wickliffe and Willaura.

  •  This Watch and Act replaces Watch and Act issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.  
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.  
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • This Watch and Act replaces Watch and Act issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.   
  • There may be increased fire activity in the Mirranatwa and Brady Swamp areas of the Grampians National Park.  
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West.
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area.  
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed.

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Armstrong, Great Western.

  • This Advice replaces Watch and Act issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The forward spread of fire in private property has been halted. 
  • Strong winds are expected from the West or South West over the next few days which may increase fire activity. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area. 
  • The Mt William communications tower has been impacted. Your phone and internet services may be affected. Tune into local radio for emergency updates.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 07:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act issued at 3:02pm Thursday 26 December.
  • The bushfire at Coffeys Rd, Bullengarook remains contained.
  • Crews are working to bring it under control.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Listen to ABC Ballarat 107.9 FM (www.abc.net.au/ballarat) or ABC Radio Melbourne 774 AM (www.abc.net.au/melbourne).
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads remain closed: Coffeys Road, Carrolls Lane and Waterloo Flat Road.
  • Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed, including Finger Point Road and several adjoining tracks.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Firefighters will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.location: Barton, Jallukar, Jimmy Creek, Kia Ora, Londonderry, Mafeking, Moyston, Watgania, Willaura North
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Barton, Jallukar, Jimmy Creek, Kia Ora, Londonderry, Mafeking, Moyston, Watgania, Willaura North.

  • This Emergency Warning replaces the emergency warning issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in an easterly direction.
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West.
  • It is too late to leave the area safely so you must take shelter now.
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed.
You are in danger and need to act immediately to survive.

The safest option is to take shelter indoors immediately. It is too late to leave.
What you should do:
You should move indoors: 
  • Protect yourself by wearing long sleeves and trousers, made from pure cotton or wool. Wear leather boots.  
  • Bring your pets inside.  
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents and turn off cooling systems. 
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you. 
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire.

If your home catches on fire: 
  • Move away from the rooms that are on fire, closing doors behind you.
  • As soon as the bushfire has passed the house, or conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. Staying inside a burning building will almost certainly end in death. 
  • It may still be too hot to remain outside, so you will need to seek shelter in another structure or last resort option.

If you cannot get indoors, last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are travelling: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the warning area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • If you are currently driving slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are caught in fire in your car: 
  • Park off the road behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows. 
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents. 
  • Turn your car engine off. 
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Embers are being carried by the wind ahead of the main fire and starting spot fires.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
  • Bushfires can generate extreme heat. Heat will kill you before the fire reaches you.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35441/moreinfo

- This Emergency Warning replaces the emergency warning issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.  
- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
- The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in an easterly direction.
- Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
- It is too late to leave the area safely so you must take shelter now.
- The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed.


        You are in danger and need   to act immediately to survive.

The safest option is to take   shelter indoors immediately. It is too late to leave.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Bellellen, Black Range, Pomonal. 
  • This Emergency Warning replaces the emergency warning issued on 26 December 2026. Please note that the warning areas for the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd fire have been updated to simplify the warning areas.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.  
  • The bushfire is travelling from the Grampians National Park in an easterly direction.  
  • Winds are expected to sustain over the coming days from the West - South West. 
  • The communications tower at Mt William has been impacted. Your mobile and internet services may be affected. Tune in to local radio to stay informed.
Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • You should leave and head towards Stawell. 
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
Relief Centres: 
Ararat - Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat.
  • Register your attendance at Ararat relief centre via this link.
  • Companion animals are welcome, but must remain on a lead at all times. Please ensure you bring any necessary items for your animals such as food, water bowl and bedding. 
Stawell - Grampians Community Health (known as "The Shacc"), 22 Patrick Street Stawell. 
  • Register your attendance at Stawell relief centre via this link
  • Pets are welcome, please ensure they are on a lead at all times.
In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Embers are being carried by the wind large distances ahead of the main fire and starting spot fires.
  • Trees can fall across roads and cause dangerous driving conditions.
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 27/12/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
